dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, 2020. What a wild ride, right? Unbelievable uncertainty, but, uh, Wall Street, they kinda just… got rich.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, twenty twenty. What a wild ride, right? Unbelievable uncertainty, but, uh, Wall Street, they kinda just... got rich.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There was unbelievable uncertainty throughout most of the year, but amid it all, everyone on Wall Streetfrom billionaire investors to hidebound millennial day traders in their pajamasgot rich.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's wild when you think about it. The markets dropped like a stone early on, but then, like, a 50% recovery in months? Just bananas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's wild when you think about it. The markets dropped like a stone early on, but then, like, a fifty percent recovery in months? Just bananas.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Financial markets dropped like a stone early in the Covid-19 crisis and then recovered nearly 50% in a span of months, one of the fastest rebounds ever seen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And who was behind a lot of that, you ask? Well, it was these young, quarantining day traders, you know? They were like, beating the professionals to buy the dip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And who was behind a lot of that, you ask? Well, it was these young, quarantining day traders, you know? They were like, beating the professionals to buy the dip.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Millions of young quarantining day traders were behind the markets rise, often beating the professionals to buy the dip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! I mean, it was the "inmates taking over the asylum" a bit, armed with those free trading apps.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! I mean, it was the inmates taking over the asylum a bit, armed with those free trading apps.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Then the inmates took over the asylum. Armed with free trading apps, retail investors bought stocks and options like never before, leading to skyrocketing values in the most speculative parts of the market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And corporations, they weren't sitting idle either. Gorged on cheap debt, then boom, IPOs started humming like the Dot-Com era again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And corporations, they weren't sitting idle either. Gorged on cheap debt, then boom, I P Os started humming like the Dot-Com era again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thanks to the governments accommodations, corporations gorged on cheap debt in 2020 to get past Covid. Once markets recovered, initial public offerings began to hum like nothing seen since the Dot-Com-bubble era.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and let's not forget the SPACs! That market for speculative IPOs, uh, just exploded.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and let's not forget the S P A C s! That market for speculative I P Os, uh, just exploded.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A market for speculative IPOs, called SPACs, took shape so bankers could list electric vehicle companies, marijuana growers and online gambling stocks, which Robinhood traders would promptly bid to the stratosphere. Some 250 SPACs are likely to go public this year, raising over $80 billion in money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, like, listing everything from electric vehicle companies to marijuana growers. And those Robinhood traders just bid them to the stratosphere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, listing everything from electric vehicle companies to marijuana growers. And those Robinhood traders just bid them to the stratosphere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A market for speculative IPOs, called SPACs, took shape so bankers could list electric vehicle companies, marijuana growers and online gambling stocks, which Robinhood traders would promptly bid to the stratosphere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Though, to be fair, smart money was also put to work. Big investors had enormous years too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Though, to be fair, smart money was also put to work. Big investors had enormous years too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid it all, smart money was put to work, and big investors had enormous years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Like Baillie Gifford's Scottish Mortgage Trust. Managed by, um, Edinburgh-based folks, but a tremendous bargain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Like Baillie Gifford's Scottish Mortgage Trust. Managed by, um, Edinburgh-based folks, but a tremendous bargain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Managed by Edinburgh-based Baillie Gifford, this investment trust (Ticker SMT:L) is a tremendous bargain.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah. For a tiny fee, you get exposure to Tesla, Amazon, all these high-growth stocks, even private companies like SpaceX. Just incredible returns.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah. For a tiny fee, you get exposure to Tesla, Amazon, all these high-growth stocks, even private companies like SpaceX. Just incredible returns.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For a 0.36% fee, you get a portfolio of stocks managed by the worlds best stock-picking firm and exposure to dozens of valuable private startups. Its investments in Tesla, Amazon, Tencent and a few dozen high-growth stocks have propelled it to a 400% gain over the past five years. The trust also holds nearly 20% of its assets in private companies such as Ant Financial, SpaceX, Stripe, ByteDance, Affirm, Epic Games and TransferWise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And those Robinhood traders, again, you know, easy to dismiss them as amateurs. But their collective instinct to buy the Covid dip and bet on innovation? That was right.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And those Robinhood traders, again, you know, easy to dismiss them as amateurs. But their collective instinct to buy the Covid dip and bet on innovation? That was right.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although they commit many investing sinsfor instance, hyperactive and speculative tradingtheir collective instinct to buy the Covid dip and bet on innovation was right.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It was. They really did put some of Wall Street to shame. I mean, billionaires got, like, almost two trillion dollars richer last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It was. They really did put some of Wall Street to shame. I mean, billionaires got, like, almost two trillion dollars richer last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Worlds Billionaires Have Gotten $1.9 Trillion Richer In 2020

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. But, uh, what about the big names? Berkshire Hathaway, they were outperforming too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. But, uh, what about the big names? Berkshire Hathaway, they were outperforming too, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Outstanding Firm: Blackstone Led by billionaires Stephen Schwarzman and Jonathan Gray, Blackstone is outperforming peers by dint of its investments in logistics and life sciences real estate and its bets on businesses like Tradeweb, Paysafe, Oatly, Bumble and buyout firm BC Partners. Blackstones stock is up 19% this year, outperforming most on Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, absolutely. Through their real estate investments, and even bets on companies like Oatly and Bumble.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, absolutely. Through their real estate investments, and even bets on companies like Oatly and Bumble.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Outstanding Firm: Blackstone Led by billionaires Stephen Schwarzman and Jonathan Gray, Blackstone is outperforming peers by dint of its investments in logistics and life sciences real estate and its bets on businesses like Tradeweb, Paysafe, Oatly, Bumble and buyout firm BC Partners.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then there’s that crazy Thoma Bravo deal, flipping Ellie Mae for a nine-billion-dollar profit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's that crazy Thoma Bravo deal, flipping Ellie Mae for a nine-billion-dollar profit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, the real estate market is going bonkers, and Thoma Bravo minted a $9 billion profit selling the business to the parent company of the New York Stock Exchange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Just insane. But the forecast, you know, Forbes is still calling for a prolonged bull market. Low interest rates, strong households.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just insane. But the forecast, you know, Forbes is still calling for a prolonged bull market. Low interest rates, strong households.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes Forecast: The Biden Bull Market The stars are lining up for a prolonged bull market as rock-bottom interest rates, strong household balance sheets and the eventual reopening of America give tailwinds to the economy and financial markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and companies that benefited from the pandemic, like Apple, Zoom, Microsoft, they're set to gain for years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and companies that benefited from the pandemic, like Apple, Zoom, Microsoft, they're set to gain for years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even better, the companies that benefited from changes accelerated by the pandemic, like Apple, Zoom, Microsoft, Amazon, Prologis and Verizon, should see gains for years to come.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And if we're talking standout investors of the year, um, Cathie Wood with her Ark funds, just completely crushed it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And if we're talking standout investors of the year, um, Cathie Wood with her Ark funds, just completely crushed it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And drumroll, please The Forbes Finance & Investing Person Of The Year: Cathie Wood, Founder, Ark Invest

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. Her flagship ETF, like, up 150% year-to-date. What a year, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. Her flagship E T F, like, up one hundred fifty percent year-to-date. What a year, huh?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her flagship Ark Innovation ETF is up 150% year-to-date, and assets have surged to $15 billion.
